AvD.synopsis: The battle has been wearing Daisy down and the voice of the Absolute grows stronger the closer we are to it. Daisy is struggling, but wants to know how we’re doing, and complements us on our progress so far. Relationship-building and trust consolidation - brings us closer to the intimacy we need for romance in Act 3.
AvD.how_to_trigger: Queue Campnight NIGHT_DaisyCourseCorrectionEnd the Day and Go to Bed

AvD_66.text: Ketheric Thorm is important, but there's clearly more to it than that.

AvD_21.text: The creature that took him away - he was controlling it. But how?

AvD_91.text: The answers must be in the illithid colony. We must find it, and uncover its secrets.

AvD_73.text: Wherever Ketheric went - that must be the place where we will learn the secrets of the Absolute.

AvD_20.text: So you found the seat of the Absolute's power, and what a power it is.
AvD_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player wakes up, standing in the dream field. Daisy looks exhausted, worn out, leaning against a rock/pillar.NodeContext: Daisy leaning with their shoulder and back to a pillar, walks forward and stand to face player

AvD_53.text: I trust you've come to your senses?
AvD_53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy puts their hand down, looks to the ground.

AvD_37.text: We have to work together or the Absolute will enthral us both. I cannot keep this up indefinitely.
AvD_37.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy puts their hand down, looks to the ground.

AvD_90.text: But it's good to see you're making progress.
AvD_90.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy gives a weak but sincere smile. NodeContext: Daisy sits down

AvD_76.text: Ketheric Thorm is clearly important, but I wonder if there's more to it than that.

AvD_62.speaker: Narrator
AvD_62.text: You did a brave thing, infiltrating a githyanki crèche under Vlaakith's inquisition.

AvD_159.text: A lot of githyanki lives were lost when you destroyed it. Does that bother you?
AvD_159.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player sits on the ground next to Daisy

AvD_31.text: But now that they know you have the artefact, Vlaakith's forces will hunt you to the ends of the world. Are you afraid?
AvD_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player sits on the ground next to Daisy

AvD_29.speaker: Player
AvD_29.text: Let them come. I will face them.

AvD_17.speaker: Player
AvD_17.text: I did what I had to to ensure our survival.

AvD_87.speaker: Player
AvD_87.text: Of being hunted by a goddess? Yes.

AvD_171.speaker: Narrator
AvD_171.text: You took an unexpected route here.

AvD_13.text: You did a brave thing, saving those people in the grove.
AvD_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player sits on the ground next to Daisy

AvD_27.speaker: Player
AvD_27.text: It wasn't even a choice. They needed my help.

AvD_111.speaker: Player
AvD_111.text: I did what I could, but I'm not sure they'll survive out there on their own.

AvD_65.text: Don't be so hard on yourself. It's not your fault the world is wicked. You did the right thing.

AvD_147.speaker: Player
AvD_147.text: It doesn't seem like my help did them much good. The cultists caught up with them.

AvD_39.speaker: Player
AvD_39.text: It was a waste of time. I regret it now.

AvD_130.text: Our task is more important, yes, and yet you did not begrudge others their lesser needs. For what it's worth, I think you did the right thing.

AvD_161.speaker: Player
AvD_161.text: I didn't do it for them. The goblins were in my way, so I killed them.

AvD_157.text: It's a good thing you decided to infiltrate the cultists rather than fight them. The Absolute has already mustered an impressive army, and its forces still grow.

AvD_40.text: Does what happened in the grove bother you?
AvD_40.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player sits on the ground next to Daisy

AvD_74.speaker: Player
AvD_74.text: It seems I enjoyed it, I still don't know why.

AvD_42.text: For what it's worth, you made the right choice. If we don't accomplish our goals, none of this matters. Not their fate, not anyone's.

AvD_118.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy reacts subtly to a sudden sharp pain in the head - they are trying to hide the pain from the player.

AvD_12.speaker: Narrator
AvD_12.text: *The hurt runs deeper than they're willing to show you.*

AvD_139.text: The voice of the Absolute. Stronger this time.
AvD_139.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy recovers from the pain, a little breathless, a little weaker.

AvD_148.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy recovers from the pain, a little breathless, a little weaker.

AvD_24.speaker: Player
AvD_24.text: Focus! Don't you dare drop my protection.

AvD_93.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy recovers from the pain, a little breathless, a little weaker.

AvD_131.speaker: Narrator
AvD_131.text: *Beneath the resilient veneer, a touch of fragility. They need comfort.*

AvD_151.speaker: Player
AvD_151.text: You look terrible. Do you need a hug?

AvD_150.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player embraces Daisy, gives them a close, comforting hug. When the hug is done, Daisy is a little misty-eyed.

AvD_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player embraces Daisy, gives them a close, comforting hug. When the hug is done, Daisy is a little misty-eyed.

AvD_170.text: It's been a very long time since someone did that. For me.

AvD_127.speaker: Player
AvD_127.text: Just how long have you been trapped inside that Prism?

AvD_124.text: Time works differently here. It's hard to explain. Sometimes I can barely even remember what it was like before...

AvD_153.text: A woman by the name of Belynne. We were close.

AvD_108.speaker: Player
AvD_108.text: Don't get used to it. I'm more of the strong and silent type.

AvD_57.speaker: Player
AvD_57.text: You just looked like you needed it.

AvD_77.text: It just doesn't stop. We are being bombarded by waves of telepathic energy.
AvD_77.context: NodeContext: Daisy catches themself drifting and switches back to action and urgency

AvD_88.text: Wave after wave with hardly a breath between them. I almost dare not rest.

AvD_160.text: Each wave, a set of orders to the infected. The order for your transformation has been given many times already.

AvD_102.text: Yes. But the orders are oddly erratic. As if the Absolute cannot make up its mind. I don't fully understand.

AvD_10.speaker: Player
AvD_10.text: Is there anything I can do to help you?

AvD_69.text: I'm afraid this burden is one I have to carry alone.

AvD_11.text: I just hope my powers last long enough to see this through.

AvD_82.text: In any case, the Absolute knows you carry me with you now. It wants to retrieve me.

AvD_168.speaker: Player
AvD_168.text: Why does the Absolute want you?

AvD_70.text: I know. I'm glad you are on my side.

AvD_25.speaker: Player
AvD_25.text: Can I still count on you?

AvD_156.speaker: Player
AvD_156.text: Perhaps I should hand you over.

AvD_92.text: You'd turn into an illithid before you know it.

AvD_51.speaker: Player
AvD_51.text: Did you steal the power to protect us from the Absolute?

AvD_145.text: I stole it from Vlaakith. Her continued rule depends on it.

AvD_172.text: I understand you are still misguided by your faith in the lich queen. But such faith is blinding you from the truth.

AvD_30.text: As long as the Absolute exists, I am trapped within the Prism. I can only control the power from here.

AvD_99.text: We must make sure Vlaakith never gets her hands on the Prism. Nor the Absolute.

AvD_2.text: Unfortunately they are both dedicating more and more resources to retrieving it.

AvD_84.text: No. It belonged to another. But that is not for you to concern yourself with.

AvD_81.text: I am the only one who can resist the Absolute's influence. Hence its fear of me, its desperation.
AvD_81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy picks themself off the ground,

AvD_97.text: Unfortunately, that also means it is dedicating more and more resources to my retrieval.

AvD_32.text: The task ahead is monumental. But you've proven that you have the resolve to do what must be done.

AvD_79.text: I would've picked another route than assaulting the Absolute in its seat of power, at least until I knew what we were up against. But you made the choice for us.

AvD_52.text: I hope that defeating Ketheric will give us the answers we seek.

AvD_49.text: Now I must rest, and you must carry on. Do not let my efforts be in vain.
AvD_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dream field and Daisy fade out of view with a parting shot of Daisy still pained, suffering, but smiling through it. The player wakes in camp.

AvD_85.text: You've shown your loyalty to the Absolute, but to gain an audience with it, you must prove yourself to Ketheric Thorm.

AvD_103.text: The task ahead is monumental. But we're all that stands between victory for the Absolute and freedom for all.

AvD_44.text: This is not just about you and I anymore. It has become far bigger than us.

AvD_142.text: The most loyal among the cultists receive an audience with the Absolute. To do this, they comply with Ketheric. You should do the same.

AvD_138.text: You must infiltrate Moonrise Towers. Discover the secrets of the Absolute and put an end to it. So we can finally be free.

AvD_23.speaker: Player
AvD_23.text: You won't give up, will you?

AvD_94.context: NodeContext: a little hurt you even asked

AvD_123.speaker: Player
AvD_123.text: So you keep on saying. Why should I believe you?

AvD_26.text: I'm not going to argue with you but pray you never find out.

AvD_98.speaker: Player
AvD_98.text: Do you know where the orders are coming from?

AvD_117.text: You're on the right track. It's in Moonrise Towers. But I don't know where exactly.

AvD_120.text: There is no doubt. Moonrise Towers.

AvD_47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player embraces Daisy, gives them a close, comforting hug. When the hug is done, Daisy is a little misty-eyed.

AvD_96.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player embraces Daisy, gives them a close, comforting hug. When the hug is done, Daisy is a little misty-eyed.

AvD_104.speaker: Player
AvD_104.text: Pull yourself together. We've got work to do.

AvD_71.speaker: Narrator
AvD_71.text: *Beneath the resilient veneer, a touch of fragility. They need comfort.*

AvD_154.speaker: Narrator
AvD_154.text: *Beneath the resilient veneer, a touch of fragility. They need comfort - and in this dream world, you can touch without fear of harming them.*

AvD_34.speaker: Player
AvD_34.text: Yes. I am full of regret.

AvD_115.speaker: Player
AvD_115.text: I try not to think about it.

AvD_58.speaker: Player
AvD_58.text: I haven't lost any sleep over it.

AvD_75.text: Not many have the ability to know what they want and do what they want, regardless of the needs of others.

AvD_56.text: You don't let yourself become weighed down by things that don't matter.

AvD_80.text: You don't care what others think of you. You just follow your instincts.

AvD_109.text: You could have helped the people in the grove, but what then? The cultists' influence is growing by the day, and the road to Baldur's Gate is long.

AvD_135.text: Who's to say they would even have survived?

AvD_83.text: Your efficiency is to be commended.
AvD_83.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player sits on the ground next to Daisy

AvD_137.speaker: Player
AvD_137.text: Perhaps I would have enjoyed myself more if I had been less efficient...

AvD_162.text: You made the right choice. If we don't accomplish our goals, none of this matters. Not their fate, not anyone's.

AvD_126.speaker: Player
AvD_126.text: I'm not proud of leaving people behind. I wish I'd helped.

AvD_67.text: I don't know how much longer I can resist it.
AvD_67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Daisy puts their hand down, looks to the ground.

AvD_132.text: The voice of the Absolute is strong here. And getting stronger.
AvD_132.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player wakes up, standing in the dream field. Daisy looks exhausted, worn out, leaning against a rock/pillar.NodeContext: Daisy leaning with their shoulder and back to a pillar, walks forward and stand to face player
